main_definition: A period of 24 hours, from one midnight to the following midnight; a specific point in time or the duration during which an event occurs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The twenty-four hours of a day as used in terms of date and time
meanings_and_examples.example: I will see you on Friday, April 5th.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A specific point or instance within the period of one day when an event occurs
meanings_and_examples.example: The sun rose at 6:30 AM today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used metaphorically to describe a significant amount of time, as in 'a lifetime's work',
meanings_and_examples.example: She spent her whole day working on the project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of measurement for how long something takes
meanings_and_examples.example: It took me a full day to finish painting my room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The period between one sunrise and another, commonly used in poetry or literature
meanings_and_examples.example: She walked through the forest under the shade of its trees during the warm days of summer.
